BBEX3.M.SDG.EUR.CA.AB.A01: Exchange rates for the euro in Sudan / EUR 1 = SDG ... (selling)

General: Listed in SDD until June 2007; see BBEX2:M:SDD:EUR:CA:AB:A01. The Sudanese pound (SDG) has been in circulation since 10 January 2007, when it was introduced at a rate of SDD 100 = SDG 1. The SDD remained legal tender alongside the SDG until 30 June 2007.
Source: Central Bank of Sudan (Bank of Sudan), Khartoum
Comment on 2007-07: Listed in SDD until June 2007; see BBEX2:M:SDD:EUR:CA:AB:A01.

Comment on 2012-06: The Sudanese pound was devalued on 25 June 2012. We recorded the following exchange rates (buying/selling): 24 June 2012: EUR 1 = SDG 3.3570 / 3.3738 25 June 2012: EUR 1 = SDG 5.5414 / 5.5691 Calculated devaluation: 39.4%.

Comment on 2013-09: The Sudanese pound was devalued on 24 September 2013. We recorded the following exchange rates (buying/selling): 23 September 2013: EUR 1 = SDG 5.9487 / 5.9785 24 September 2013: EUR 1 = SDG 7.6533 / 7.6916 Calculated devaluation: 22.3%.
